Summary
Welcome to #üé≠ricochet-1-quest! This is the start of the #üé≠ricochet-1-quest channel.
DM [Ricochet] BOT 31-03-2024 23:04
# BEGIN: Stitched Together (Delana's Arc Quest)
Blinsky [Ricochet] BOT 04-04-2024 19:17
A day or two ago, Delana received the following note by messenger:
Dearest Delana! My name is Gadolf Blinsky and I am a toy maker in Vallaki. Rumors have reached my ears that you have a wondrous companion who is not alive, but a puppet! I LOVE puppets!! I would love to meet you and your companion. I myself am a student of the magnificent Fritz Von Weerg!!! who was a genius inventor and automaton maker. I believe we would have much to discuss. Please come visit me soon! Your Friend, Gadolf Blinsky
DM [Ricochet] BOT 04-04-2024 19:23
Blinsky's toy shop sits near the center of Vallaki, just down the street from the main Town Square, and a few buildings away from the burned out Vallakovich mansion where the former, and still missing, Burgomaster Vallakovich resided. The toy shop is painted in yellow -- bright and cheery, by Barovian standards -- with purple wood trim. It stands apart and occupies a corner overlooking a crossroads, a place that would otherwise be a prime spot for a storefront. And yet if anyone observed the toy shop for any length of time, they would see that no one seems to enter the building or look its way. There are a few townsfolk in the streets, hurrying from one place to another and trying to get out of the rain, all of them with purpose, none of them glancing towards the toy shop. Are Vallakians just not into toys, perhaps? In any case, on this chilly Spring day, the building may look like a welcome haven from the cold rain. Or it may not. A sign in the window says: OPEN, Please come in!
Ludens(Severin‚Å∂)+1 04-04-2024 19:33
Severin wondered around Vallaki a bit, and seeing the toyshop he decided to investigate. He plans to make more magical creatures that animate from figurines, and a toy-shop is good for inspiration He sends around his spider so it can spy a bit for him, then eventually he enters himself. Fully armored, only carrying a small dagger and a lot of charms, he doesn't quite fit either the average knight or mage, sitting awkwardly somewhere in-between. His metal suit is adorned with engravings and rubies, his coat having fine red fabric on the inside and a tough fur on the outside, but even that layer won't hide how oddly thin he is, even with the armor. He doesn't say a greeting as he enters, beginning to look around the shop...
Delana BOT 04-04-2024 20:32
Delana does a gentle knock on the now opened door. Her eyes look around precariously, a hand over Alleria‚Äôs head to shelter the puppet from the rain as best that Delana‚Äôs hand can. ‚ÄúI heard that there is a Mr. Gadolf Blinksky looking for me..?‚Äù Delana walks in farther, squeezing her hair and Alleria‚Äôs as much as she can, before quickly fixing both their hairs.
Ludens(Severin‚Å∂)+1 04-04-2024 20:34
A metal snake on Severin's shoulder turn towards Delana, its ruby eyes affixed to her and her puppet for a few moments. Then it lays flat on the armor, becoming less alert seemeingly, but keeping an eye
DM [Ricochet] BOT 04-04-2024 22:39
The doorway of the building leads into a short hallway between the two large window displays, which then opens up onto the shop floor. The main room is two stories tall, with an upper-floor balcony that wraps around three sides of the room. There is a display in the center of the floor and two more off to each side, and the walls are lined with shelves packed with toys of all different kinds. There are rocking horses with real hair of some kind, little toy soldiers with bright, shiny spears and swords, stuffed bats that look startlingly lifelike, a carousel of snarling wolves, dolls of various shapes and sizes and make from ballerinas to crude baby dolls to little kids attached at the hand, wind up wooden sets of teeth with fangs, a miniature gallows with a chopping block sporting a shiny little axe, bags of marbles made to look like eyes that are all staring directly at customers, and other delightful little knicknacks. From a room behind the main counter comes a crash that sounds like a box full of bells fell over. "One muoment, please! Blinsky wyill be right thyere!!"
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 05-04-2024 00:46
Not long after Ro splits ways with Severin, it comes to his mind that he forgot to ask where to find him again should there be any future crafting request. Ro quickly walks back to the market, and after walking further a bit more, there in front of a relatively quiet building Ro spots him again. > "Sev-" Ro was about to call for him, but the armored mage has already entered the building. Ro follows up inside the building, just as the rushing sounds of the bell crash still rings in the air.
ü§£ 1
Delana BOT 05-04-2024 00:52
Delana turns towards the new person who has walked inside. ‚ÄúOh, hello. I apologize if I am in your way.‚Äù Delana shuffles to the side a bit, looking at Alleria and gently tugging the puppet over to the side so Ro can walk towards the armored man.
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 05-04-2024 00:55
Ro turns towards the drow with a nod and a smile, as usual for this tortle monk. > "Ah, no worries there, you're good.." And as everyone knows, you often forget what you're in here for once you walk past a doorway, especially when passing through the doorway gives you a unique sight, such as this toyshop with various displays designed to attract attention. And Ro is old. > "Is this.. a toy shop? Interesting." Ro mumbles to himself, loud enough to be audible to Delana and Severin.

‚≠ê 1
Draven Stormblade BOT 05-04-2024 02:12
Having been out on a nightly investigation draven would decide to take a break to try and get out of the rain. Happening to find himself by the toy store he thought he might as well enter. Walking through the door he shakes his hood and outer clothes to get the worst of the water off when he notices Delana "Quite the boring weather we have to day if I do say so myself" He would say to acknowledge he had seen her and trying to be friendly. Secretly a little off put by the friendly looking building. For Draven hasn't forgotten how he nearly lost his life to a jack in the box las he was here

üåßÔ∏è 1
Aelian Felde BOT 05-04-2024 08:55
Enter Aelian *Aelian has been perusing the store alone -- or well, with Minerva, his familiar -- before the lots came in. Being a dollmaker himself, he's interested to see what Blinsky has in store, quite literally. He's heard from a child in Vallaki that the man has created dangerous toys, the kind that hurts? Hard to believe, because why would a toymaker do so? Hearing the ruckus at the front of the store, the dollmaker appears from behind one of the cabinet, peeking curiously. He immediately looks at Delana, smiling in recognition.* "Oh my, Lady Delana, nice to see a familiar face here! What brings you here?"
Blinsky [Ricochet] BOT 05-04-2024 10:18
‚ÄúLady Delana??‚Äù Another crash of a foot or an elbow knocking into the box of bells, a mumbled curse of pain, a screech from a monkey, and suddenly Blinsky himself appears from the back hallway. He is a rotund man with a short beard and mustache wearing a jester‚Äôs hat. A monkey in a pink ballet tutu sits on his shoulder, clutching the hat and staring at the newcomers. ‚ÄúIs it true? You hyave decided to visit dear old Blinsky??‚Äù He is beaming from ear to ear as his eyes alight on everyone in the room, looking for the puppet he has heard so much about. He spies Minerva and squeals in delight, bending down to look at her with a finger held out. ‚ÄúOh, she is yeahbsolutely marvelous!! So yanimated! Such false intyelligence behind the eyes! How does she muove? What yanimates her? Please, please tell Blinsky everything!‚Äù He seems to be completely ignoring every other potential customer in the room by now. (edited)
üòÇ 2
Draven Stormblade BOT 05-04-2024 10:33
Turning his head to the rather jovial fellow the masked man would look him up and down "Greeting mister Blinsky. You certainly have more energy than last I saw you. Have you been of good health since your toys revolted 8 months ago?" He would say trying to gauge if he was recognised at all though not expecting it
Blinsky [Ricochet] BOT 05-04-2024 10:56
Blinsky straightens up and looks at the person addressing him quizzically. ‚ÄúEight months? Was thyat the scroll which yanimated the‚Ä¶ no, thyat was Yule.‚Äù He stands there, hand stroking his beard in deep thought while the monkey glares at Draven, trying to see inside his mask. ‚ÄúThe shipment to Krezk, myaybe? But Blinsky thinks thyat was luonger ago‚Ä¶ and the stuolen prototypes were recovered just lyast week‚Ä¶‚Äù A lightbulb goes off. ‚ÄúAh! The demons! Yes, you wyere there to hyelp poor old Blinsky! Oh hyappy day!‚Äù He reaches out as if to hug Draven quite suddenly, then the monkey screeches and Blinsky stops and backs down. ‚ÄúAh, hehe, my apuologies. Blinsky is just so excited to meet so myany wuonderful people all in one day!‚Äù (edited)
Draven Stormblade BOT 05-04-2024 11:04
"It is quite alright. And I am impressed you remember me. Didn't expect to have made the biggest impact after one of your possessed toys nearly did me in" He says with a flat tone in an attempt to make a joke but not really getting you are suppose to say it in a more jovial tone
Ludens(Severin‚Å∂)+1 05-04-2024 11:16
Now Severin turns around to see the events for himself, a light red glow being visible behind his visors as he has Detect Magic active again to spot anything potentially interesting in the shop. The snake on his shoulder also turns so that it can keep facing everybody. But despite that, he still doesn't say a word or approach the others more closely
Draven Stormblade BOT 05-04-2024 11:19
Severin would catch multiple sources of magic emanating from not only draven in the form of abjuration and conjuration magic but also hints of conjuration magic from the light mist flowing around his feet
üòÆ 1
Ludens(Severin‚Å∂)+1 05-04-2024 11:27

Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 05-04-2024 11:32
Severin would see Ro glowing with magic all around, with all of his magic items that he is carrying and wearing, though nothing particularly unusual for a seasoned adventurer in Barovia. Hearing about the demons Blinsky mentioned, Ro replied: > "Ah, the demons graced this shop as well? They were everywhere, huh.." Ro says that as he walks around admiring all the toys in the store.
Minerva [Aelian's familiar?] BOT 05-04-2024 11:40
She ever so slightly shimmies away from Blinksy's held out finger, giving a mixture of nervous and surprised glance towards Aelian.
Aelian Felde BOT 05-04-2024 11:40
"Oh, umm..." Aelian is taken aback by the sudden hail of questions, though he quickly uses Draven's conversation as an opportunity to regain his composure. "Well met, Mister Blinksy. It's a little bit complicated, but to answer it briefly. It's magic, of course, a powerful one that I don't exactly know myself. I am but a simple dollmaker. Her consciousness is given by someone else at one point. But either way, it's nice to finally see the man behind the rumours." He ends his answer with a polite bow, which is followed suit by Minerva as well, though with a silent grumble.
Aelian Felde BOT 05-04-2024 11:42
"The name's Aelian Felde, by the way. Well met to you all." He looks at Blinksy, then to the others, especially the ones he isn't acquainted with yet.
Aelian Felde BOT 05-04-2024 11:50
To Severin's magic detection sense, he would see this simple human dollmaker is equipped with a lot of magic items, from simple to powerful ones. The small doll itself also has a hint of conjuration. (edited)
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 05-04-2024 11:51
Ro shifts his gaze from the toys to respond to the dollmaker out of politeness. > "Hi there, I'm Ro, nice to meet you too. I've never seen you before. You don't often visit Barovia village? That's where I usually hang around."
Aelian Felde BOT 05-04-2024 11:53
"Oh I actually do. But I tend to keep to myself in Blood on the Vine. Still, nice to meet potential ally." He gives a polite nod back to the Tortle.
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 05-04-2024 12:03

Blinsky [Ricochet] BOT 05-04-2024 17:32
Blinsky seems poised to answer Ro's inquiry by launching into a very thorough explanation of every single creation on the shelves around the room, but he halts when Delana speaks up. He turns towards Alleria, blinking. His jaw drops. "TH-THIS is your poppet?!?!" He hurries forward, stopping suddenly within a foot or two of Alleria, hands pulled together in front of him, fingers waggling as if he is barely containing the itch to touch and inspect and explore the creature. He licks his lips and rubs his face with both hands. "She... but she luooks... she is an eylf, like you! But... ah... Blinsky does see the veery fine stitching now... very fine indeed! Is this your wuork? She is magnificent! You syimply must tell Blinsky how you myanaged this marvel!" "Oh, this is a wuonderful day for dear old Blinsky!!" he says, clapping his hands together and bouncing a little.
1
Delana BOT 05-04-2024 23:17
Delanas face slightly flush against her dark skin at the praise of Alleria. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a bit gruesome for wear, but for now, It is simply some attention to detail and my ability as a seamstress.‚Äù Delana does a slight bow. ‚ÄúThank you for the compliment on my sewing ability. There are still some parts I see as sloppy, but I suppose I keep it from when I first..‚Äômade‚Äô her? It‚Äôs been a very long time.‚Äù
Blinsky [Ricochet] BOT 05-04-2024 23:30
"Syimply wuonderful!!" Blinsky says, smiling from ear to ear. "A seamstress, you say? Blinsky has some tyalent with faebric, you see..." He rushes over to one of the shelves and picks out a doll and shows it to the group. She is plush and dressed like a ballerina, with something that might be horse hair stitched to her scalp. In one hand is a tiny knife that looks remarkably sharp and metallic. Blinsky points to the doll as he explains. "Here, see, Blinsky did embroyder the stitching for hyer eyes, hyer mouth and nuose, eyelyashes too! The hyair was veery difficult as always, because it likes to fly eeverywhere while Blinsky is trying to stitch." He straightens up with some pride for a moment. "Blinsky did myanage to become muore skilled as an artist with duolls in particular, since we hyad a customer who, for myany months, would hyave us remake one, single duoll perhyaps one hundred times to get it jyuuuuust right! Phew, Blinsky is glead that contract is uover..." "But alas," he pauses, looking back to Alleria and Minerva, "Blinsky cyannot myake our creations eanimated, no myaatter how hyard he tries. Wuould you tyell Blinsky how you myanaged it...?" There is nothing but desperate hope in his eyes.

Delana BOT 08-04-2024 00:33
Delana looks around the store once more before gently clicking her tongue, mostly to herself. The prized toys of Blinky start disintegrating in the hands of those who hold them. Almost like ash, it‚Äôs gone. Delana looks at Blinksy and lightly cups her own cheek, eyes slightly widened. ‚ÄúOh no, Blinksy..your toys..‚Äù
ü§£ 1
Blinsky [Ricochet] BOT 08-04-2024 01:19
The monkey on Blinsky‚Äôs shoulder starts screeching first, shaking the jester hat so the bells twinkle ominously. Blinsky doesn‚Äôt move, but his eyes go saucer-wide and his mouth falls slack as he watches his precious toys crumble and fall. ‚ÄúThe‚Ä¶ the toys‚Ä¶!!! Blinsky is cursed yet again!! Is it the ghost of Myaster Von Weerg here to punish me for revealing his secrets?!!‚Äù He starts backing up, stumbling over the corner of a shelf and searching desperately for whatever might be causing this horror.
Aelian Felde BOT 08-04-2024 02:20
*Aelian watches in confusion then amusement as the toys suddenly disintegrate. Surely this is an illusion, because the weight in his hand is still the same.
Minerva [Aelian's familiar?] BOT 08-04-2024 02:20
Minerva, on the other hand, is screaming along with Blinksy. "No, no! Just when I thought I finally get a nice castle! If this is one of the enchantment, this is not funny at all!"
üòÇ 2

DM [Ricochet] BOT 09-04-2024 18:48
The next morning dawns in the misty, grey light of 'slightly less dark.' One way or another, the newly convened party members make their way to the gates of Krezk on the far western side of the valley. The small village is completely walled, with guards standing at the gate and patrolling the ramparts. On the hill overlooking the village, an impressive building that looks vaguely religious stands watch. Delana's map shows the Von Weerg mansion may lie on the other side of the village, in the forest.

ü§£ 4
DM [Ricochet] BOT 10-04-2024 21:53
With Draven leading the way, the party skirts the edges of the mysterious walled village, headed into the forest beyond. Draven being Draven, they almost lose him in the mist and fog, but thankfully Ro's knowledge of wilderness tracking and Delana's keen eyes keep them on his trail. After a little more than half an hour of trudging through the snow, they arrive at a two-story cobblestone building shrouded in towering pine trees. While the stone structure itself stands firm, the wooden braces and support beams have been eaten away by rot and grasping vines. A crumbling stone fence surrounds the building, and the path from Krezk has long since worn away and overgrown, leaving the lonely building largely undisturbed. They can see right away that the mansion has no discernible windows, and there is but a single prominent door in the center of the facing wall.
üéâ 2
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 11-04-2024 00:36
Ro stays in silence for a moment of observation, before asking the rest of the group: > "So.. no windows.. we knock?" Turning to Delana, he also says: > "Also.. I've been wondering to clarify our goals here.. we would like to investigate the sources of Blinsky's inspiration for his toys, or...?" Ro lets the last part trail off.
Delana BOT 11-04-2024 01:31

Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 16-04-2024 15:08

Ro takes some time to infer the meaning of all this, before reporting his findings to the group. > "So, I suppose the levers there are really our next step here.." > "Anyone feeling lucky today?"

DM [Ricochet] BOT 17-04-2024 04:39
The door opens into a glimmering, vibrantly illuminated but aging foyer. The incessant, overlapping tick and hum of machinery is dulled slightly, and the steady swing of a pendulum sets a mellow tone in the room. An iron furnace connected to a series of pipes leading up into the ceiling and down into the floor emits a dissipating cloud of steam into the air. In the center of the room, a luxurious but fraying set of seats frame a worn rug. Beyond them is nestled a gilded, wrought-iron spiral staircase that appears to lead to a second story, but cuts off at the ceiling. Two doors lead further into the building: one on the south wall, and one directly to the north in the east wall. The southern door stands open, through which can be seen two extravagant armchairs facing an elaborate multi-tiered machine connected to various pipes, tubes, and bars. The machine is mounted above a dust blanketed, cobblestone hearth that still burns with a crackling fire. Just inside the room on the floor is a heavy, rusting bear trap that has already been sprung.

Draven Stormblade BOT 23-04-2024 08:42

DM [Ricochet] BOT 23-04-2024 09:59
The images and sounds of Tser Pool are instantly replaced by a sweeping vista of snow-capped crags and a winding river in the bottom of a canyon far below. A low stone wall protects the viewer from tumbling into the gorge, and a bridge extends nearly fifty feet in each direction, passing over the canyon. Gentle, high-pitched winds howls through the cliffs overhead like wolves. Though they actually cannot feel it, the chill in the air is nearly palpable. Delana in the seat can smell the clear, snowy air and old stone, and another faint scent‚Ä¶ an avian of some kind? ‚ÄúBilliards is a game played on a specially designed table!‚Äù Harkus says over the winter scene. ‚ÄúPlayers use long sticks to take turns attempting to knock only their own marked balls into pockets around the perimeter.‚Äù
Draven Stormblade BOT 23-04-2024 10:55

Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 23-04-2024 10:57

Ludens(Severin‚Å∂)+1 23-04-2024 11:07
Severin doesn't comment on the fact of who knows what games, stepping closer to the door to perhaps suggest their departure to the construct buttler. Kicking rocks, making holes, and using sticks to hit rocks have always been part of humanoid nature, and he finds the games around them generally barbaric - as long as they lack the precision that allows them to be cognitively challenging even for the sharp minded. But he well knows that even games that have the potential for such complexity usually get dumbed down for te common people. Predictable and disappointing

DM [Ricochet] BOT 23-04-2024 19:40
"I would be delighted! This way, please." Harkus moves past Severin, barely missing him yet again, and heads to the door through which he came. He seems to move with precision, as if to compensate for his blindness, he walks only along a memorized or programmed track through the house. A wood-carved dining table stretches the length of most of the next room. Nine web-coated chairs are seated around it, and neat piles of scrap and debris have been swept beneath them. Suspended overhead, around the perimeter of the room, is a narrow track that loops in and out of a hole on the southern wall. Through an open door frame at the other end of the table, you can see another, darker room set with two billiard tables. (edited)
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 23-04-2024 23:49

And given the trick in the first room, Ro wants some more tangible assurance that the dining table and all are real, by touching them as he passes by.

The smell of rancid decay and mold hang in the air near a closed door in the southwestern corner, and the occasional spark flashes from another doorway on the same wall. Aelian Felde BOT 28-04-2024 15:15
*Aelian watches Delana in somewhat of a confusion, but not much of a surprise. He remembered when he was still a functioning human, he did experience mild sudden headache and whatnot. DM [Ricochet] BOT 28-04-2024 15:26
Harkus moves quickly once the elevator opens to the second floor. In the landing room, a decaying, faded rug swallows most of the floor. Six glass cases encircle the room and model wings made of flaking leather sway gently from unraveling ropes secured to the ceiling. A hallway leads through the center of the western wall, and a weighted wooden door ahead is bolted shut with 10 locks of varying sizes and shapes. Harkus heads immediately down the hallway, zigzagging along until he reaches a door on the southern wall and enters. A wispy cloud of steam hangs in the air. Shelves full of glittering, magical tonics, vials of wilting plants, and other apothecary's oddities stand opposite a set of stone stairs leading to an algae coated stone basin. A wooden handle connected to a chain dangles over the stone. After rushing the whole way here, Harkus now stops and turns in place. ‚ÄúOh me, oh my,‚Äù is all he says as he reaches his hands slowly out towards the counters full of tonics, feeling about for the delicate bottles, trying not to move too quickly lest he break something.
Aelian Felde BOT 28-04-2024 15:39
Minerva immediately flies out from the elevator following Harkus, though she lingers in the landing for a moment, letting Aelian surveys the room. Through her veiled eyes, he looks around for signs of other automatons here, though of course, he can't help but give those six glass cases a brief inspection as well.
DM [Ricochet] BOT 28-04-2024 18:05
The glass cases contain an odd assortment of items: a rifle made of wood and iron, a small metal trinket, two humanoid figurines the size of dolls, a small metal vehicle, and what look like metallic spider legs. There are no other automatons to be seen in the area, though the door frame to the north is warped and splintered.

ü§ûüèΩ 1
DM [Ricochet] BOT 09-05-2024 15:51
The door opens easily, swinging outwards towards the gap. Steam fills this chamber in the same way it did the previous room. Though it isn't as thick, the heat is much worse. A fiery glow points you to its source: a gargantuan forge and furnace in the center of the north wall. Pipes pierce its surface at every angle and climb the wall like ivy. Molten metal pours from its mouth toward a quenching trough abuzz with tiny, fluttering figures guiding the material into gear-shaped molds. Standing opposite you, far in the distance and shrouded in the rising cloud encircling the vast chamber, is a hulking silhouette, standing 12ft tall. It is quite rotund and stands on two stubby legs, but several long, spider-like arms extend from its body. A rhythmic ticking clicks from its body and overtakes similar sounds muted by the solid walls. Just behind its form is a portcullis and four, barred cages. A synthetic voice calls out, ‚ÄùNot Master Fritz. Intruders!‚Äù The party has just enough time to take this all in when another metallic figure, more humanoid, steps in front of the door and something within it whirs to life!
ü§ñ 3
Aelian Felde BOT 09-05-2024 17:55
Seeing a reachable target, Aelian immediately lashes with his whip. The white spectral hands engulfs the construct upon contact and reels them in towards Aelian, or rather, towards the chasm between the room. (edited)
DM [Ricochet] BOT 09-05-2024 18:20
The construct pulls up one arm ending in a wicked looking blade to strike at Aelian, but before it can do so, it begins plummeting into the darkness below. It flings out one gauntleted hand to grasp at the ledge, but misses by several feet. Some seconds later, everyone hears a loud CLANG! ringing out through the interior of the basement cavity of the house.
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 09-05-2024 18:40
## Record scratch! But wait! One might wonder, how could such an advanced construct missed a simple grapple to a stationary ledge? Let's rewind the scene a bit to discover the truth. As Aelian pulled the construct over the chasm, Ro was at the same time also aiming for the construct, still intending to push any threats away. However, seeing the thrown gauntleted hand as an attempt to grab the ledge, Ro quickly switches his aim towards the gauntlet instead, and he successfully pushed it away with the decanter he's holding, causing it to miss by several feet. And that's why, folks, make sure you have two grappling hooks instead of one, so that if one fails, the other might still prevail.
‚≠ê 2
ü§£ 2
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 09-05-2024 19:03
After spending a few seconds looking to the bottom of the chasm following the loud clang, Ro looks up again to the other threats before them. Quickly Ro throws away his decanter and his quarterstaff aside, and takes out his wand of magic missile. With a quick swipe across the direction of the room, Ro sends a tiny missile to each of the visible figures in the room, tiny and giant alike, announcing their presence like a gentleman Ro is with those gentle taps from the magical force. Ro then steps back a bit, preparing for their response.

üò± 1

DM [Ricochet] BOT 23-05-2024 01:32
As soon as Aelian passes through the dark veil of shadow, he is greeted with not darkness, but dim light. The room on the other side is quiet. A scarlet red banner adorned with crossed rifles dresses the far wall alongside a purple banner with a roaring lion. The steady flicker of torchlight dazzles on mounds of gem shards pouring over the lip of a barrel in the south of the hall. Thick, hardwood tables clearly carved of the ash-grey trunks of the Svalich Wood form a U-shape following the north wall and are overflowing with a slew of bits, baubles, and books. Hastily heaped under the desk is a mound of bones.

DM [Ricochet] BOT 26-05-2024 06:02
The ‚ÄòSOUL TRANSFER‚Äô notes are written in tiny script, with sentences wrapping around the margins and arrows pointing every which way. It seems Master Von Weerg was researching‚Äî and experimenting with ‚Äîthe physiological and arcane evidence of the soul, specifically in an effort to prolong or even renew life. His notes document attempts to both identify and then transfer a soul to a new body, typically, but not always, a construct. Reading over Delana‚Äôs shoulder, Ro recognizes the references to physiology. Descriptions of using various body parts and alchemical components as catalysts litter the pages, most of them crossed out. Towards the end of the notes are the following conclusions: Blood is key!! Need contact with vessel. More is better. Skin? Best if vessel has some. More = better. Reduces soul friction. Skin as arcane disguise?? HA. Trick energy transfer. Like to like flows smoother. Preservatives needed?? More blood + more skin = more memory transfer. Need SPACE. Energy output big. Outdoors! Below that is a schematic for something labeled ‚Äòsoul siphon engine.‚Äô

DM [Ricochet] BOT 30-05-2024 17:27
It's a long and arduous climb, weaving under metal pipes, over gears, and trying to make sense of the hundreds of intricate mechanisms that keep the house running, all while trying not to slip back down with the wrong step. But Draven's feet are sure, and he climbs all the way up through two stories to the top where he finds a 5-foot ladder leading up to a trap door. On opening the trap door, he finds himself behind an illusory wall, which he can only tell is illusory because he's on the wrong side of it. The depth and angles of the image are backwards. The rest of the room is a small closet occupied only by a small, marble dais with a glowing leather case resting on top of it.

DM [Ricochet] BOT 08-06-2024 04:27
A relatively short search later, the group finds the metal contraption that must be the soul engine detailed in Von Weerg‚Äôs notes. It‚Äôs hard to miss, given it‚Äôs the only metal object in the woods near the mansion. Miraculously, it looks entirely unharmed by the outdoor elements. There are several elements that stand out: a small set of prongs not unlike the setting for a gemstone on a ring; a set of wires with clamps extending out from the apparatus; and a long tube with a needle on the end.
‚≠ê 1
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 08-06-2024 11:34
Ro looks at the magical machine in curiosity even though his limited understanding of things magical and mechanical is limited. > "Interesting mechanical contraption.." Ro circles around the machine, still not approaching it just yet, to see more of the machine from different angles.
Draven Stormblade BOT 08-06-2024 11:38
"Alright. We found this thing. Now what do we do with it?"
Ludens(Severin‚Å∂)+1 08-06-2024 12:47
"Cast Detect Magic on it"
PM
Severin states, and does so without delay
DM [Ricochet] BOT 08-06-2024 13:40
For now, the machine registers no magical auras in its dormant state. But from the artificer‚Äôs notes, Severin knows a gemstone must be supplied to initiate the process.
1
Ludens(Severin‚Å∂)+1 08-06-2024 17:28
Since there is a bit of time, Severin will cast Identify ritually on the machine. He is sure that the needle is for connection one's blood supply to the machine, and for gems they need something like what they found in the mansion, but he isn't there to detail that yet to the others if they didn't figure it out
DM [Ricochet] BOT 09-06-2024 11:53
Once the ritual completes, understanding washes over Severin as threads of latent magic appear scattered over the apparatus. The needle is indeed for harvesting blood to fuel the transfer. It is collected in a small reservoir accessible from the outside. The gem is inserted to use as a catalyst and container for whatever essence makes up the soul, memory, identity of an individual. The wires are the output method. It was designed with constructs in mind, but there appears to be no reason they wouldn‚Äôt work on any qualified receptacle. With these theories in place, the machine could likely be used for any sort of memory sharing between one vessel to the next, up to and including complete transfer, and could therefore provide access or a tangible way to access memory itself. Of note, part of the memory transfer magic indicates it creates an unstable aura of some size. Probably why Von Weerg put the thing outside, away from his mansion and all its mechanical inhabitants.

DM [Ricochet] BOT 12-06-2024 08:22
With Severin adding with arcane insight and Ro standing by as the resident physiologist, the group carefully begins preparing Delana, Alleria, and the soul engine for... whatever might happen next. Aelian supplies a suitably fine ruby from Von Weerg‚Äôs hidden laboratory, placing it in the frame on one side of the machine, and Draven watches warily from nearby. With the syringe and tubing connected to Delana and the wires clamped onto Alleria‚Äôs arms, Severin pulls the switch to activate the arcane machinery. Everything happens so fast. A rapid clicking noise erupts from the machine, followed by a low hum that reverberates through the surrounding woods. The little reservoir barely registers Delana‚Äôs blood before it disappears into the machinery. The gem begins to glow. A tiny patch of skin on Alleria‚Äôs arm also begins to glow. The patch that Delana accidentally sewed through her own fingers that fateful night. Delana‚Äôs skin. A shimmering thread of red light materializes between the patch of skin on Alleria and Delana‚Äôs hand. It twists and vibrates and grows erratic as the machine seems to respond in kind, arcs of electricity appearing along the wiring and the ruby‚Äôs casing. Then the red strand of light arcs violently toward the machine, a shockwave of pure silence exploding outwards. Everyone‚Äôs vision goes black. . . . The first thing everyone notices as their senses return are the sounds of the forest. Not the silent groaning of ancient trees in the Svalich Wood, but birdsong and breezes through branches. (edited)
‚≠ê 3
üëÄ 1
Draven Stormblade BOT 12-06-2024 12:43
Reaching to his head draven tries to get up "What in the world was that. I should have put a greater distance between myself and that thing. Did it kill us?"
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 12-06-2024 15:12
At the return of his senses, Ro's fighter instincts quickly push him to check his surroundings for any immediate threat, and upon discovering it seems pretty safe, he then proceeds to check, as the resident physiologist, up on Delana and Severin, who were closest to the machine. > "Are you two okay?"
Delana BOT 12-06-2024 16:10
Delana is almost stun locked. She didn‚Äôt expect that Alleria‚Äôs patch would glow in correspondence to what happened that night, nor did she think she‚Äôd see trees. ‚ÄúIm ok, I currently am feeling just a mild amount of shock. I did not expect Alleria‚Äôs skin spot to glow.‚Äù

üëÄ 1
DM [Ricochet] BOT 14-06-2024 17:07
The group follows Delana's sure footsteps through the old forest growth. The air is sickly sweet and heavy rather than the stale dampness of misty Barovia. This forest is alive and ripe with decay and new growth, the cycle of life consuming life everpresent. Moss and vines grow wild and bright... making it easy to see the not infrequent deep gashes on tree trunks as they pass. Some look old and grown over, others are fresh, as if great beasts sometimes crash through the forest without care for avoiding obstacles. Delana knows exactly what they are. This is her forest, after all.
üòû 1

ü§î 1

DM [Ricochet] BOT 14-06-2024 18:09
Severin examines the marks on the trees as they pass in detail. The patterns of damage don't make sense. Some look like claw marks from great forest beasts like bears, some look like smaller animals, but with a depth to the gashes that signify great strength behind them. Some are teeth marks, and some are just limbs crashing into things. What amalgamation of things could cause this much destruction?

üí™üèº 3
DM [Ricochet] BOT 17-06-2024 01:51
The group races through the forest, not knowing what exactly lies ahead. Even Delana can only guess at what time they've arrived and what they might find. Draven and Ro arrive first to see smoke rising from cottages behind a tall wall. Drow archers atop the wall are firing arrow after arrow at whatever breached the wall. A thick gate lies halfway off its hinges, wood splintered around iron hardware. It's almost reminiscent of Vallaki or Krezk back in Barovia, with the strength of the fortifications to keep the forest and its horrors at bay. And horrors they are. It's difficult to see from this distance, but Draven and Ro at least clearly see a drow warrior thrown through the air from one side of the street to the other, just beyond the gate. A great, bellowing wail of dozens of chittering voices sounds out as the archers release another volley into the beast.

DM [Ricochet] BOT 19-06-2024 21:15
"Damned creatures, never sending their calling cards ahead of sieges!" shouts Alleria, downing another crawling creature approaching from the right with two arrows in quick succession. "How dare they, right??" The group, visible and not, makes their way into the town through the ruined gate. The walls and houses are made of stone for the most part, but there's enough wood in the roofs, windows, doors, and various other items throughout town that fires are burning. Archers line the walls, and several drow warriors with scimitars, rapiers, and axes are running about and engaging the monstrosities. They're even worse than you imagined from Delana's descriptions. Some are great, writhing masses of flesh and bone and teeth while others are look like they may have been a whole, normal animal at some point, but now have darting tentacles and pustules covering their bodies. Still others appear mostly humanoid except for the gaunt limbs and skin reddened with blood and exposed muscle. One such monstrosity ambles towards them now, its face an open flower of teeth and flesh, and sends out a screeching battlecry at the new meat.

Delana BOT 26-06-2024 18:19

DM [Ricochet] BOT 26-06-2024 19:35
Indeed, the two drow work quickly, trying to seal up the lesions across her body. Severin‚Äôs magic draws more cries of pain, but as fast as the wounds stitch together, they seem to start bleeding anew. The arcane casters among them might recognize the effect as similar to Chill Touch. Something from the monster is poisoning her veins and preventing healing magic from taking hold. Another medic runs over to check on her and the two share a long look, then both glance over at Delana in shame and worry before they nods and begin carrying her away, to die away from Delana‚Äôs eyes. Yet another drow jogs over to Delana. ‚ÄúMistress, you‚Äôre needed in the morgue. Selin is looking for you.‚Äù (edited)
üò≠ 2

DM [Ricochet] BOT 26-06-2024 19:50

I‚Äî‚Ä¶ I‚Ä¶ Yes, Mistress.‚Äù He runs off to do her bidding. Somewhere nearby, Alleria is dying. And soon, she will rise not as a puppet, but as something monstrous. Unless Delana helps her.

DM [Ricochet] BOT 28-06-2024 18:47
The morgue is full of dozens of bodies already, with more being carried in. Delana gets to work and the party witnesses the skill she truly has with needle and thread as she begins stitching up the bodies. Perhaps what is most interesting and alarming to the others is the fact that she starts with the ones that are groaning and moving. Indeed, as soon as a body begins to twitch, Delana is there with all speed, furiously and expertly sewing up their wounds. The more they twitch and flail, the faster she works, and every time she finishes off a final stitch, the bodies collapse once again into the stillness of death. Some time goes by as she makes her way through the beds before the group notices a presence come up next to them from the doorway behind. A tall drow woman of extreme age stands there, watching Delana work, her stone face hiding any emotion besides calm command. "Delana, my child," she says quietly, her voice reverberating through the morgue in its steadiness.

‚≠ê 4
üåü 1
DM [Ricochet] BOT 07-07-2024 00:04
As Delana finishes the incantation, she feels her mind go blank for a long moment, then everything snaps back into place with crushing force like a rubber band. The effect threatens to knock her from her feet. Even Aelian, Severin, Draven, and Ro feel a noticeable magical shockwave from the ritual‚Äôs finish. Cyuro rushes forward and puts out a hand to steady her, and Cyte and Celaney exchange concerned glances. Suddenly, everything comes flooding back. All the memories she had lost. All the memories she had absorbed. Dozens and dozens of lost family lines for whom Delana had become the sole caretaker over the years. The historian. The Mourner. And she looks down at Alleria‚Äôs body and realizes she is the only one who remembers who she was. Who will ever remember her, except through watered-down third-hand accounts. ‚ÄúThe community needs you. You must take their pain before it poisons and weakens us.‚Äù Isn‚Äôt that what Selin said? Because there is no pain without memory. Except for Delana. The Alleria on the table sits up, and Cyuro screams. (edited)

ü´Ç 2
DM [Ricochet] BOT 12-07-2024 00:59
Delana stands there, contemplating all she has learned, when Celaney walks up behind her to place a gentle hand on her shoulder. "Delana Tluier, One who holds the Mourning Families Tears and Mourns those of Lonesome, an Elder of Irlaea. It is time." With that, the perspective of the world around the group begins to shift, objects becoming pinpricks and reality stretching. A dense fog closes in, but it's red -- blood red -- and it fills everyone's nostrils with the scent of iron. It's hot and suffocating and--- And everyone awakens, lying in the damp earth around the Soul Engine in the Svalich Wood behind Von Weerg's mansion. Alleria is nowhere to be seen.

Delana BOT 14-07-2024 16:51
Delana doesn‚Äôt look up, yet a hiccup echos out from where she is. It‚Äôs been a bit since she‚Äôs been comforted, yet the words ring true. Her back and chest quivers up and down, and a light sob is heard from her kneeled position, her back relaxing from its straight position into one more comforting. ‚ÄúThank you..‚Äù
DM [Ricochet] BOT 15-07-2024 08:21
Gradually, the group collects themselves and prepares to leave the Von Weerg estate and the forest behind. The soul engine stands dormant once more, as if it didn‚Äôt just launch them all on a traumatic memory drive using blood magic. Together, they make their way back to Vallaki and the odd toy shop where they all met and decided to undertake this little journey. It is again raining when they arrive in the doorstep of Blinsky‚Äôs shop, and an odd sense of d√©j√† vu overtakes them as they step through the entryway.

Aelian Felde BOT 15-07-2024 11:32
Aelian has been weirdly silent the entire way back, seemingly deep in thought, but the familiar sight of the toy shop is always a good way to turn that around. He hurried to the door, opening it for the others to walk through, and turns to the toymaker will a flourish. "Well, nice to see you seemingly enjoying your day, Mr. Blinsky. We return bringing a- uh ... both good and slightly bad news." He specifically eyes Delana, as if inquiring how much they should tell this person.

The dollmaker internally realizes he does still have a huge gaping hole in his chest from Fritz's mechanical sentinels. Though of course, his stagnant smile is as bright as ever. "... Blinsky [Ricochet] BOT 18-07-2024 20:06

He runs into a back room and everyone hears stomping on stairs through the back of the building, the opening and slamming of a trunk, and Blinsky's hasty descent. He reemerges, winded and a little red. "This flute cyame into Blinsky's possyession many years pyast, and Blinsky is not gifted with musical bones, hehe! Oh no. We would liek it veery much if you became the new cyaretaker." The flute he holds out to Delana is extravagantly crafted with clean lines and deep, purple wood.
Delana BOT 18-07-2024 21:05

Blinsky [Ricochet] BOT 18-07-2024 21:18
Why indeed? By all appearances, the toymaker could use the cash, as they haven't seen a single customer in either of their lengthy visits. "Blinsky does it for the luove of craftsmanshyip and artistry. That is all."

However, upon checking what he has on his person, it is unfortunate that Ro cannot find suitable gift. > "Blinsky, if you need anything wooden to be crafted, don't hesitate to find me around Barovia village. The idea of contributing to the children toys collection here sounds like a good idea to me.." Ro trails off a bit as he smiles his old man smile and nods to Blinsky, as a gesture of goodbye.

DM [Ricochet] BOT 23-07-2024 17:47
With a hand over his heart and a tear in one eyes, Blinsky waves goodbye to the group one by one, very happy to have made some new friends and fellow lovers of craft. # END: Stitched Together (Delana's arc)
